sections:
146 read with
196 of Motor Vehicles Act
Plea
full_text:
In the Court of the Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate,
Thiruvananthapuram
Present: Elsa Catherine George
Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate.
Dated the 4" day of March 2025
CC: 833/2024
Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector of Police,
Pettah Police Station in Crime No. 1379/2023
(By A.P.P )
Accused : Praveen, 26 years, S/o Balakrishnan, Puthuveedu,
Near Sree Bhadrakali Temple, Perukavu Desom,
Pavachalkuzhi Ward, Vilavoorkkal Village.
Offence : u/s 279, 337 and 338 of IPC and section 146 r/w
196 of Motor Vehicles Act
Plea : Guilty
Finding : Guilty
Sentence/order : Accused is sentenced to pay a fine of %.4500/- for the
offence punishable u/s. 279, 337 and 338 IPC and
section 146 r/w 196 of Motor Vehicles Act and in
default; to undergo simple imprisonment for 45 days.
This case having been heard today, the court passed the following:-
JUDGMENT
1. Accused stands charged with the offences punishable u/s. 279, 337 and 338 of
IPC and section 146 r/w 196 of Motor Vehicles Act.
2. Accused entered appearance. Requirements u/s.207 Cr.PC was complied with.

The particulars of offences were read over and explained to the accused to which
he pleaded guilty. I accept the plea since I am convinced of its genuineness and
that the same is made voluntarily. Hence, I find the accused guilty of the offences
punishable u/s. 279, 337 and 338 of IPC and section 146 r/w 196 of Motor
Vehicles Act and accordingly he is convicted and sentenced to pay a fine of
%.4500/- for the offence punishable u/s. 279, 337 and 338 IPC and section 146
r/w 196 of Motor Vehicles Act and in default; to undergo simple imprisonment for
A5 days.
Dated this the 4" day of March 2025.
